Title: PCF Validation & Audit Specialist
RoleDescription:
DATA VALIDATION
In this role, you will validate PCF data from both existing and new suppliers to secure reliable data for reporting to Global Sustainability. You will conduct sense-checks and audits following a risk-based approach and the 4-eye principle, reviewing documentation such as methodologies, data sources, and calculation processes to ensure credibility and reliability. Additionally, you will assess the transparency and robustness of the methods used by suppliers, cross-reference their data with industry standards and benchmarks, and confirm that all relevant emissions scopes (Scope 1, 2, and 3) are correctly accounted for. CONSULTING AND STAKEHOLDER SUPPORT
You will provide guidance and support to internal departments and suppliers regarding PCF optimization measures and their impact on carbon footprint reduction. By acting as a consultant, you will help stakeholders understand the validation requirements and develop reliable PCF calculations that contribute to our sustainability objectives. OPERATIONALIZE AND EXECUTE GUIDELINES
A key part of your role will be to develop and implement standardized processes for assessing supplier data in close collaboration with Global Procurement, Global Sustainability, and other relevant stakeholders. You will ensure that suppliers, co-packers, and partners comply with company guidelines and, where necessary, break down reporting standards into market- or supplier-specific guidelines. You will also guide and, if needed, directly support main suppliers in achieving robust and reliable PCF calculation processes. MANAGE EXTERNAL SUPPORT
Where external expertise is required, you will be responsible for selecting and coordinating with external experts to carry out data validation effectively and efficiently. BE THE EXPERT
As the subject matter expert, you will share your knowledge and insights with internal teams and operational roles, supporting them in executing their tasks related to PCF validation and ensuring that best practices are embedded across the organization.A university degree in Environmental or Bioresources Management, Nutritional Sciences, Food Science, Biotechnology, Chemistry, Technical Chemistry, Process Engineering, or a related field.Fluency in English is required, and proficiency in German is highly beneficial for this role.Hands-on experience in calculating and validating Product Carbon Footprint (PCF) data.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a data-driven mindset.Solid understanding of quality processes and compliance, ideally in the food and beverage industry or a related sector.A collaborative team player with strong consulting skills and the ability to build effective relationships in an international environment.Comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with the ability to manage multiple priorities.Due to legal reasons, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary according to the collective agreement for this position, which is  2446 gross per month.
